name: Project WHAT!
description: Project WHAT! (We’re Here And Talking!) is a paid leadership and advocacy program for Bay Area youth ages 12-17 who had or currently have an incarcerated parent. Focussed on serving young people in San Francisco and Oakland, but are also open to those who live in other parts of Alameda County and Contra Costa County. ​ The goal of Project WHAT! is to create a community that encourages children (ages 9-12) with incarcerated parents to use their voice, pride, and power. howToGetIt: -Submit an inquiry at project.what@communityworkswest.org or call (510) 268-8116 to learn more about the programs offered. -If you'd like for Community Works West to follow up with you directly, visit https://communityworkswest.org/contact/ and complete the form to leave your information.
